instruction: In a bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.440 This Mogalpur chicken has a crisp, sizzling sound.

instruction: Add chicken pieces to the marinade along with green chilies, half of the mint and coriander leaves. Mix thoroughly and cover. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
title: Marinate Chicken

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:03.440 This Mogalpur chicken has a crisp, sizzling sound.
00:00:04.620 --> 00:00:08.280 Sometimes, you just feel like making a rich dish at home.
00:00:08.280 --> 00:00:09.960 This is how Mogalpur style is.
00:00:09.960 --> 00:00:24.740 This is early morning—woke up and made chicken curry. Don’t ask why. People comment a lot, saying to make chicken biryani.
00:00:24.740 --> 00:00:54.740 Everyone loves biryani. It's like they were born for it. Even if it’s not your birthday, biryani feels like a celebration.
00:00:54.740 --> 00:01:24.720 Everyone celebrates with biryani like it’s a tradition.
00:01:24.720 --> 00:01:54.720 In the market, you’ll find chickens weighing 3-4 kg, but we should buy around 2 kg for proper biryani.
00:01:54.720 --> 00:02:24.720 When we ask in restaurants, they give small pieces because they divide the chicken into 3-4 pieces per plate.
00:02:24.720 --> 00:02:54.720 In our region, we marinate the chicken properly. After a couple of hours, it becomes tender and full of flavor.
00:02:54.720 --> 00:03:22.900 Add chili powder and mix well. Don’t just sprinkle it on top; coat the chicken properly.
00:03:22.900 --> 00:03:30.720 Now, when we eat the pieces, they should taste delicious.
00:03:30.720 --> 00:04:00.720 At home, add green chilies, mint, and a bit more spices for extra flavor.
00:04:00.720 --> 00:04:30.720 Don't add too much garam masala. Just a little cumin and coriander powder is enough.
00:04:30.720 --> 00:05:00.700 Use good oil. A little cumin and coriander powder is enough to bring out the taste.

instruction: Thinly slice the onions. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat and fry the onions in batches until golden brown and crispy.
title: Slice and Fry Onions

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:30.720 --> 00:05:00.700 Use good oil. A little cumin and coriander powder is enough to bring out the taste.

instruction: Remove fried onions and place on paper towels to absorb excess oil. Set aside half for layering later.
title: Drain Fried Onions

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:30.720 --> 00:05:00.700 Use good oil. A little cumin and coriander powder is enough to bring out the taste.

instruction: Mix the remaining half of the fried onions into the marinated chicken.
title: Add Onions to Marinade

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:30.720 --> 00:05:00.700 Use good oil. A little cumin and coriander powder is enough to bring out the taste.

instruction: Rinse basmati rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
title: Rinse and Soak Rice

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:30.720 --> 00:05:00.700 Use good oil. A little cumin and coriander powder is enough to bring out the taste.

instruction: Warm the milk slightly and add saffron strands. Let it sit for 10–15 minutes to release color and aroma.
title: Prepare Saffron Milk

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:30.720 --> 00:05:00.700 Use good oil. A little cumin and coriander powder is enough to bring out the taste.
00:05:00.720 --> 00:05:08.160 Once it’s cooked well, it smells amazing.
00:05:08.160 --> 00:05:38.160 We usually see large setups in hotels, but I’m showing you a simple homemade method using curd.

instruction: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add salt and whole spices (cloves, cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon, star anise, peppercorns).
title: Boil Water with Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: 00:05:38.160 --> 00:06:08.140 We’ll marinate it simply with curd and basic spices.

instruction: Drain soaked rice and add it to the boiling spiced water. Cook until the rice is 70% done—grains should still be slightly firm. Drain the rice immediately.
title: Parboil the Rice

transcript_segments.text: 00:06:08.160 --> 00:06:38.160 Once rice is boiled once, drain the water. It should be semi-cooked before layering.
00:06:38.160 --> 00:07:08.140 Add salt accordingly and boil the rice until it’s 70% done.
00:07:08.140 --> 00:07:38.120 Boil it until it's semi-soft so it finishes cooking with steam.
00:07:38.120 --> 00:08:08.120 Once boiled, strain it well. Prepare for layering now.

instruction: Grease the bottom of a heavy-bottomed pot with a little ghee. Spread the marinated chicken evenly as the bottom layer.
title: Prepare for Layering

transcript_segments.text: 00:08:08.120 --> 00:08:15.120 Chicken should be 70% cooked before layering.

instruction: Spread the parboiled rice evenly over the chicken layer.
title: Layer the Rice

transcript_segments.text: 00:08:15.120 --> 00:08:45.120 Put the chicken at the bottom of the pot. Add a small bowl of rice in layers.
00:08:45.120 --> 00:08:48.560 Add all masalas evenly.
00:08:48.560 --> 00:08:51.000 The pot should be heavy-bottomed.
00:08:51.000 --> 00:08:54.240 Make sure the rice inside is also half-cooked.
00:08:54.240 --> 00:08:55.920 Water should be in proper ratio.
00:08:55.920 --> 00:08:59.580 Use 4 cups of water for 1 cup of rice.
00:08:59.580 --> 00:09:00.960 That’s when it cooks perfectly.
00:09:00.960 --> 00:09:05.040 Now, layer everything and close the lid.
00:09:05.040 --> 00:09:09.700 Once it's 70% done, lower the flame and seal the pot.
00:09:09.700 --> 00:09:39.700 Steam it well. That’s how biryani cooks through. Don’t overcook the rice.
00:09:39.700 --> 00:10:09.700 Aromatic smell will spread—chicken, mint, onions, all come together beautifully.
00:10:09.700 --> 00:10:16.320 Layer rice without breaking the grains.

instruction: Top with the reserved fried onions, remaining mint and coriander leaves, saffron milk, and drizzle with ghee.
title: Add Final Garnishes

transcript_segments.text: 00:10:16.320 --> 00:10:46.320 Top it with mint, remaining onions, and a bit of ghee for flavor.
00:10:46.320 --> 00:10:53.820 Don't add too much oil. Just enough to enhance the taste.

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid or seal the edges with dough to trap steam inside.
title: Seal the Pot

transcript_segments.text: 00:10:53.820 --> 00:11:23.820 Now place a heavy lid. Some use flour paste to seal it tight. Do what suits you.

instruction: Place the sealed pot on high heat for 5 minutes. Then reduce to very low heat and let cook (dum) for 25–30 minutes.
title: Cook on High and Low Heat

transcript_segments.text: 00:10:53.820 --> 00:11:23.820 Now place a heavy lid. Some use flour paste to seal it tight. Do what suits you.
00:11:23.820 --> 00:11:53.820 Steam builds up inside. After 10 minutes, let it come out slowly.
00:11:53.820 --> 00:12:23.820 Don't lift the lid too early. Let the steam settle first.
00:12:23.820 --> 00:12:53.820 Now keep the flame high for 10 minutes for final cooking.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani sit for 10 minutes to settle and absorb flavors.
title: Rest the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: 00:12:53.820 --> 00:13:23.820 Then reduce heat. Meanwhile, I’ll tell a story—once, I took biryani to school…
00:13:23.820 --> 00:13:53.820 Everyone was amazed. They asked who made it. My dad said, “My son made this.”
00:13:53.820 --> 00:14:23.820 Back then, I’d fill the house with the biryani smell. Now things have changed.
00:14:23.820 --> 00:14:27.960 When people argue, they say, "Let’s get divorced."
00:14:27.960 --> 00:14:57.960 Instead, I say, “Come, let’s eat biryani and talk.”
00:14:57.960 --> 00:15:05.460 I say this often—but today, my wife isn’t around. I’ll tell her next time.
00:15:05.460 --> 00:15:35.460 Use a flat heavy lid. Place weight on top to trap steam.
00:15:35.460 --> 00:16:05.460 If it looks a bit raw, leave it to dry slightly. Let the water evaporate fully.
00:16:05.460 --> 00:16:35.460 This is our homemade chicken biryani. Just look at it—perfect texture and aroma.
00:16:35.460 --> 00:16:40.540 Don’t just eat it randomly. There's a way to eat biryani too.
00:16:40.540 --> 00:16:46.960 See this here? That’s mace flower—called javitri.
00:16:46.960 --> 00:16:51.120 If you eat it whole, it’s bitter. Remove it before eating.
00:16:51.120 --> 00:17:21.120 The fragrance is amazing. We use whole spices like cloves, cardamom, peppercorns.
00:17:21.120 --> 00:17:51.120 When you serve biryani, mix it slightly before serving. Don’t leave it tight-packed.
00:17:51.120 --> 00:18:21.120 My mom doesn’t like this type of biryani. But whenever I eat it, I remember my hometown.
00:18:21.120 --> 00:18:51.120 Even on Sundays, when we’d go out and have this, I would return home and make it for my family.
00:18:51.120 --> 00:18:54.420 Now I live abroad. But I still have permission to make biryani!

instruction: Gently fluff the rice with a flat spoon without breaking the grains. Serve hot with raita, salad, or mirchi ka salan.
title: Serve

transcript_segments.text: 00:18:51.120 --> 00:18:54.420 Now I live abroad. But I still have permission to make biryani!
